DataElement.preferredName: Lawton-Brody Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale 3 Ability Prepare Your Meals Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response about their ability to prepare food, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lawton-Brody Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale Ability Prepare Your Meals Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A functional assessment instrument that was developed by Lawton and Brody in 1969 to assess an individual's ability to perform eight complex tasks of daily living that are necessary for living in a community._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._A question about whether an individual is able to prepare meals for themselves._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Lawton-Brody Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A functional assessment instrument that was developed by Lawton and Brody in 1969 to assess an individual's ability to perform eight complex tasks of daily living that are necessary for living in a community.

A question about whether an individual is able to prepare meals for themselves.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Plans, prepares and serves adequate meals independently) to 4 (Needs to have meals prepared and served) on a 4-point Likert scale.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Can you prepare your own meals
ReferenceDocuments.description: Can you prepare your own meals

ReferenceDocuments.name: Lawton-Brody Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale (I.A.D.L.)
Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
